commit.message:
Fixed links to source code on GitHub from the documentation

With the current version, if you open e.g. this page:
https://python-markdown.github.io/reference/markdown/blockprocessors/

The ‹› links on the right side of the page will point to URLs like
https://github.com/Python-Markdown/markdown/tree/3.6//home/runner/work/markdown/markdown/md/markdown/blockprocessors.py

This commit fixes them by replacing `filepath` with `relative_filepath`.
Bump version to 3.6

verification.payload:
tree 0018a6ac7fc75c2da9b5e32938503a446c4e58bb
parent 3d8afc6f89e169522f44c1bbec15f66dc359eccb
author Waylan Limberg <waylan.limberg@icloud.com> 1710430550 -0400
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1710430550 -0400

commit.message:
Allow attr_list quoted values to contain curly braces

How it worked before:

  * Extract the content without allowing any `}` in it, and require that it ends with `}` - for block elements anchored to the end of the line, otherwise not.
  * Parse the content in more detail. No edge cases with `}` can arise. If parsing is interrupted by some unrecognized token, discard the rest of the string.

How it works now:

  * Extract the content *and allow* `}` in it, and require that it ends with `}` - for block elements it's anchored to the end of the line, otherwise not.
  * Parse the content in more detail. Allow `}` only within the quoted parts, otherwise interrupt parsing like for any other unrecognized token.
    If parsing is interrupted, there is remaining unrecognized text. Ideally perhaps we would bail out at this point entirely (and not recognize it as an attr_list), but to preserve historic behavior, any extra text before `}` is just discarded.
    If there is an extra `}` in the remaining text:
      * For block elements: that must mean that the attr_list syntax did not in fact terminate at the end of the line but earlier. So, bail out and do not register any attributes and do not change the original text.
      * For inline elements: that must mean that we just overmatched a bit, but that's OK, we just assign attrs as normal and put the extra text back into the string. As mentioned, any extra text *before* `}` is just discarded.

verification.payload:
tree 36ecb1e41f8bfc52d003d8580c7ac4a506ba7bb7
parent 9edba85fc14f034b7109534220702bf60178ff15
author Oleh Prypin <oleh@pryp.in> 1710258879 +0100
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1710258879 -0400

Allow attr_list quoted values to contain curly braces

How it worked before:

  * Extract the content without allowing any `}` in it, and require that it ends with `}` - for block elements anchored to the end of the line, otherwise not.
  * Parse the content in more detail. No edge cases with `}` can arise. If parsing is interrupted by some unrecognized token, discard the rest of the string.

How it works now:

  * Extract the content *and allow* `}` in it, and require that it ends with `}` - for block elements it's anchored to the end of the line, otherwise not.
  * Parse the content in more detail. Allow `}` only within the quoted parts, otherwise interrupt parsing like for any other unrecognized token.
    If parsing is interrupted, there is remaining unrecognized text. Ideally perhaps we would bail out at this point entirely (and not recognize it as an attr_list), but to preserve historic behavior, any extra text before `}` is just discarded.
    If there is an extra `}` in the remaining text:
      * For block elements: that must mean that the attr_list syntax did not in fact terminate at the end of the line but earlier. So, bail out and do not register any attributes and do not change the original text.
      * For inline elements: that must mean that we just overmatched a bit, but that's OK, we just assign attrs as normal and put the extra text back into the string. As mentioned, any extra text *before* `}` is just discarded.

commit.message:
Refactor abbr escaping

A alternate fix to #1444. This does not exclude the use of carrots or square 
brackets in abbreviations. It still excludes backslashse, however. I played
with backslashes and it just doesn't make sense to support them as they 
have special meaning in the Markdown, not because of their use in regular
expressions.

verification.payload:
tree 39694374a2f77c021c134e9f40274882e901b5d2
parent e4ab4a610edc6332ce81a53aa4ae6f97516ce461
author Waylan Limberg <waylan.limberg@icloud.com> 1709909078 -0500
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1709909078 -0500

Refactor abbr escaping

A alternate fix to #1444. This does not exclude the use of carrots or square 
brackets in abbreviations. It still excludes backslashse, however. I played
with backslashes and it just doesn't make sense to support them as they 
have special meaning in the Markdown, not because of their use in regular
expressions.

commit.message:
Refactor TOC sanitation

* All postprocessors are run on heading content.
* Footnote references are stripped from heading content. Fixes #660.
* A more robust `striptags` is provided to convert headings to plain text.
  Unlike, the `markupsafe` implementation, HTML entities are not unescaped.
* The plain text `name`, rich `html` and unescaped raw `data-toc-label` are
  saved to `toc_tokens`, allowing users to access the full rich text content of
  the headings directly from `toc_tokens`.
* `data-toc-label` is sanitized separate from heading content.
* A `html.unescape` call is made just prior to calling `slugify` so that
  `slugify` only operates on Unicode characters. Note that `html.unescape` is
  not run on the `name` or `html`.
* The `get_name` and `stashedHTML2text` functions defined in the `toc` extension
  are both **deprecated**. Instead, use some combination of `run_postprocessors`,
  `render_inner_html` and `striptags`.

Co-authored-by: Oleh Prypin <oleh@pryp.in>

verification.payload:
tree 3af83350ed3b831d89dfa4e240daaeaa92de5959
parent a18765c25cccab23f400edeac94d20f4be00492b
author Waylan Limberg <waylan.limberg@icloud.com> 1709906734 -0500
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1709906734 -0500

Refactor TOC sanitation

* All postprocessors are run on heading content.
* Footnote references are stripped from heading content. Fixes #660.
* A more robust `striptags` is provided to convert headings to plain text.
  Unlike, the `markupsafe` implementation, HTML entities are not unescaped.
* The plain text `name`, rich `html` and unescaped raw `data-toc-label` are
  saved to `toc_tokens`, allowing users to access the full rich text content of
  the headings directly from `toc_tokens`.
* `data-toc-label` is sanitized separate from heading content.
* A `html.unescape` call is made just prior to calling `slugify` so that
  `slugify` only operates on Unicode characters. Note that `html.unescape` is
  not run on the `name` or `html`.
* The `get_name` and `stashedHTML2text` functions defined in the `toc` extension
  are both **deprecated**. Instead, use some combination of `run_postprocessors`,
  `render_inner_html` and `striptags`.

Co-authored-by: Oleh Prypin <oleh@pryp.in>

commit.message:
Ensure lines after heading in loose list are properly detabbed

This is a weird edge case. Normally, detabbing would be handled by
the `ListIndentProcessor`. However, in this one case, that class's
`get_level` method would need to return a different result than in
any other case. As there is no way to easily determine this specific
case from that class, we make the adjustment directly in the
`HashHeaderProcessor` class. Fixes #1433.

verification.payload:
tree 12aef11404fb0b6abf15ed175ec8dfc9769de79b
parent ea92856855a6314488acb121f21f8fa02860e008
author Waylan Limberg <waylan.limberg@icloud.com> 1706553771 -0500
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1706553771 -0500

Ensure lines after heading in loose list are properly detabbed

This is a weird edge case. Normally, detabbing would be handled by
the `ListIndentProcessor`. However, in this one case, that class's
`get_level` method would need to return a different result than in
any other case. As there is no way to easily determine this specific
case from that class, we make the adjustment directly in the
`HashHeaderProcessor` class. Fixes #1433.

commit.message:
Update the license template so GitHub can detect it

The license remains BSD 3-Clause but with a better known text
Disable mkdocstrings show_symbol_type_toc option to work around searching issue in #1432
Restore Attribute symbol type in mkdocstrings template

MANIFEST.in: Include scripts/*.py in the generated source tarball

These scripts are needed for building the documentation.
Bump version to 3.5.2

Fix handling of bogus comments.

As with most implementations, we now pass through bogus comments (as
defined by the HTML Spec) unaltered except that they are HTML escaped.
This deviates from the reference implementation which completely ignores
them. As the reference implementation seems to not have even contemplated
their existence, it is not being used as a reference in this instance.
Fixes #1425.

verification.payload:
tree 59c7c11c752179906b862f5a52baf18f202a9e64
parent a2a9c53ea262ea0d39e76aa18430ce071fbe68d5
author Waylan Limberg <waylan.limberg@icloud.com> 1704306273 -0500
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1704306273 -0500

Fix handling of bogus comments.

As with most implementations, we now pass through bogus comments (as
defined by the HTML Spec) unaltered except that they are HTML escaped.
This deviates from the reference implementation which completely ignores
them. As the reference implementation seems to not have even contemplated
their existence, it is not being used as a reference in this instance.
Fixes #1425.

commit.message:
Update docs deploy scripts

The update in 5cbabe1 didn't provide for a .nojekyll file, which is necessary when publishing to GitHub Pages to avoid Jekyll messing with our statically generated documentation.

Also added a user input to the manual deploy script which allows deploying from any past reference (tag or commit).

verification.payload:
tree d65c0153c2000bd789ee578910ef0dae61b03b51
parent a63e6f3416f2e4fc7c2d5edb2768ceed9218df20
author Waylan Limberg <waylan.limberg@icloud.com> 1699234200 -0500
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1699234200 -0500

Update docs deploy scripts

The update in 5cbabe1 didn't provide for a .nojekyll file, which is necessary when publishing to GitHub Pages to avoid Jekyll messing with our statically generated documentation.

Also added a user input to the manual deploy script which allows deploying from any past reference (tag or commit).

commit.message:
Fix edge-case crash in InlineProcessor

If an inlineprocessor returns an AtomicString (even though that is pointless, a plain string is atomic in that context), there can be an exception in 2 separate places. The added test case was crashing before this change.

verification.payload:
tree e601868703779b3e71c59a49d3171f1ed0433f37
parent f5b151ac899dd0e71bc689ecfce17ac6018789eb
author Oleh Prypin <oleh@pryp.in> 1699021200 +0100
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1699021200 -0400

Fix edge-case crash in InlineProcessor

If an inlineprocessor returns an AtomicString (even though that is pointless, a plain string is atomic in that context), there can be an exception in 2 separate places. The added test case was crashing before this change.

commit.message:
Fix edge-case crash in codehilite If there is an empty `
` inserted by another extension, there can be an exception. The added test case was crashing before this change.

Fix typo in attribute name

There are no other references to `content_indention`, and it seems that there were no problems with this only because the other line `self.content_indent = indent` kicks in in all relevant situations.
Remove legacy import needed only in Python 2
Add and improve type annotations

commit.message:
Update Docs deployment

Switch to a different action (cpina/github-action-push-to-another-repository) which has worked in testing (see https://github.com/waylan/test-repo-source).

Also updated the version of many actions in all workflows to eliminate various warnings we have been getting of late.

commit.message:
Correct the declarations of I/O buffers as bytes-based

* Correctly declare the parameter annotations as `BinaryIO`, because in fact it works only with byte-based buffers.

* `sys.stdin.read()` is always a string, so remove the Python2-specific check.
    * Correct the patch in the test which incorrectly sets `sys.stdin` to a bytes buffer which it never is.

* `sys.stdout.buffer` always exists, so remove the Python2-specific fallback.
    * Correct the patch in the test which incorrectly sets `sys.stdout` to a bytes buffer which it never is. And fix a matching mistake because this necessitated `stdout.read().decode()`.

verification.payload:
tree 4546d1ed2f2308b73058cf0b0d8c81310ea9668b
parent 2932f183921943687ca3d72b3908a937bd495d24
author Oleh Prypin <oleh@pryp.in> 1698851887 +0100
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1698851887 -0400

Correct the declarations of I/O buffers as bytes-based

* Correctly declare the parameter annotations as `BinaryIO`, because in fact it works only with byte-based buffers.

* `sys.stdin.read()` is always a string, so remove the Python2-specific check.
    * Correct the patch in the test which incorrectly sets `sys.stdin` to a bytes buffer which it never is.

* `sys.stdout.buffer` always exists, so remove the Python2-specific fallback.
    * Correct the patch in the test which incorrectly sets `sys.stdout` to a bytes buffer which it never is. And fix a matching mistake because this necessitated `stdout.read().decode()`.

commit.message: Bump version to 3.5.1

Update changelog validation (#1388)

Every edit to the changelog must be validated so that an invalid changelog doesn't block a release.

Every edit to the changelog must be validated so that an invalid changelog doesn't block a release.
